conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid from A encounters a horizontal baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid from A continues to flow rightward and reaches the vertical baffle.
Liquid from A flows downward and enters container D.
Liquid from B encounters a horizontal baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid from B continues to flow rightward and reaches the vertical baffle.
Liquid from B flows downward and enters container D.
Liquid from C encounters a horizontal baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid from C continues to flow rightward and reaches the vertical baffle.
Liquid from C flows downward and enters container D.
All the liquid from points A, B, and C will flow into container D after passing through the baffles.
The liquid will flow into container D.
